elements.text: Is cancel and change price function for an order supposed to work in simulation ? My code to play with this is basically

and that sets the order status to "Replacing" but as shown in log below it doesn't switch to "Execution complete" until 44 seconds later when the market closes and no matching done on the order. Originally placed lay bet at 7.4 none of which was matched then replaced asking for  8.8 which should have taken lower current lay price of which there were many trades less than that. Haven't found anywhere in the simulation code yet that seems to be aware of the replacing operation ?
Am I just using it wrong or it doesn't work as I think it should ?
EDIT: I am using a build from last April but still can't see any signs it would work looking at latest github ?

text: Don't you need to use market.replace_order() rather than order.replace()?

elements.text: Don't you need to use market.replace_order() rather than order.replace()?

text: Doh - that works exactly as expected - thanks so much. Followed that through and can see it gets placed on the pending set of orders which is what I couldn't find following it down through the order !

elements.text: Doh - that works exactly as expected - thanks so much. Followed that through and can see it gets placed on the pending set of orders which is what I couldn't find following it down through the order !

text: No worries. I only know it because I've been there and got the t-shirt.
